content:
# After harvesting, my inventory now contains:
# - 22 wood
# - 5 coal
# - 5 stone
# - 10 iron ore
# - 2 iron plates

# Now that I have 10 iron ore, I can smelt them in the stone furnace to produce more iron plates.
# Each iron ore will yield 1 iron plate, so I can produce up to 10 additional iron plates.

# Let's proceed to smelt the iron ore in the stone furnace.

# First, I will check the furnace's inventory to ensure it has enough space for the new iron plates.
furnace_inventory = inspect_furnace_inventory()  # Inspecting the furnace inventory
print(f"Furnace Inventory: {furnace_inventory}")  # Output the furnace inventory to check available slots

# If the furnace has space, I will add the iron ore to it for smelting.
if furnace_inventory['iron-ore'] < 5:  # Assuming the furnace can hold more than 5 items
    add_to_furnace(iron_ore_position, quantity=10)  # Adding iron ore for smelting
else:
    print("Furnace is full, cannot add more iron ore.")  # Handling case where furnace is full

# After adding the iron ore, I will check the furnace status to confirm it's smelting.
print(f"Furnace Status: {get_furnace_status()}")  # Checking the status of the furnace after adding iron ore
